definition: line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: It's a free government service for all unemployed people.
sentences.chinese: 那是为所有无业人员开设的免费政府机构。

sentences.english: He said, "Happily unemployed." And then he said, "So, Brooke!
sentences.chinese: 他说，是呀，我很庆幸我是无业游民。

sentences.english: Police data show that Germann is a notorious record of drug addicts and the unemployed.
sentences.chinese: 警方数据显示，格尔曼是个无业和劣迹斑斑的瘾君子。

sentences.english: From now on, I became a hobo.
sentences.chinese: 从今往后，我成了无业游民。

sentences.english: Hobo Chen Quan is abjection because of business failure.
sentences.chinese: 无业游民陈全因生意失败而落魄。

sentences.english: Aged 27-year-old Stephen is poorer districts Gulf tourist area jobless youth.
sentences.chinese: 现年27岁的黄伟荣是奉贤区海湾旅游区的无业青年。

sentences.english: Attempts to blame England's recent riots on youth unemployment were overhasty.
sentences.chinese: 对最近英国无业青年暴乱的谴责似乎操之过急了。
她继续说，这么说你是无业游民。

sentences.english: Surman, an American unemployed woman, at a birth.
sentences.chinese: 美国无业妇女苏尔曼一胎生了八个孩子。

sentences.english: "Hoboes" regularly knocked on their door asking for a little food.
sentences.chinese: 无业游民经常敲他们家的门讨点儿吃的。

sentences.english: But politically it is the unemployed youth in urban areas that are most likely to riot.
sentences.chinese: 但是，在市区的无业青年才最可能实施暴乱。

sentences.english: Arnold was an elderly hobo whose life was simple and uncomplicated.
sentences.chinese: 阿诺是生活是简单而不复杂的一个年老的无业游民。

sentences.english: The priests, who are Levites--indeed the whole tribe of Levi--are to have no allotment or inheritance with Israel.
sentences.chinese: 祭司利未人和利未全支派必在以色列中无分无业。

sentences.english: Liu has two children but is not employed.
sentences.chinese: 刘有着两个孩子而自身无业。

sentences.english: Coxey proposed that the federal government should hire unemployed men to build roads.
sentences.chinese: 科克塞建议联邦政府雇佣无业工人去修建道路。
他们是无业游民中的圣战者。

definition: to await job assignment (term used only in mainland China)
to be without a fixed residence (idiom)
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
to work a temporary or casual job/(of students) to have a job outside of class time, or during vacation
(coll.) to live with and depend on one's parents even upon reaching adulthood
